TITLE: YAML Configuration for Tmuxify Layout
DESCRIPTION: Example YAML configuration for defining a complex tmux layout with a main editor pane and two auxiliary panes. The layout uses percentage-based sizing and specifies initial commands for each pane.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mustafamohsen/tmuxify/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
session:
  name: my-project            # Optional: Uses directory name if omitted
  initial_focus: editor       # Optional: Focus this pane on startup

layout:
  type: horizontal            # horizontal (side-by-side) or vertical (top/bottom)
  splits:
    - id: editor              # Unique identifier for this pane
      size: 60%               # Percentage of available space
      command: "nvim ."       # Command to run in this pane
    - type: vertical          # Nested layout section
      size: 40%
      splits:
        - id: tests
          size: 50%
          command: "npm test -- --watch"
        - id: terminal
          # Size omitted: takes remaining space
          command: "clear"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic usage of Tmuxify
DESCRIPTION: Simple command to launch Tmuxify in the current directory, which will either use a local config file or create a default layout.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mustafamohsen/tmuxify/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
tmuxify
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Tmuxify Layout Examples with Bash Commands
DESCRIPTION: Instructions for copying a Tmuxify layout from the examples folder to your project directory as a .tmuxify.yml file and then running the tmuxify command to apply it.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mustafamohsen/tmuxify/blob/main/examples/layouts/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Copy to your project
cp examples/layouts/basic-2-pane.yml ./.tmuxify.yml

# Run tmuxify
tmuxify
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Tmuxify with a specific layout file
DESCRIPTION: Command to run Tmuxify with a specific layout file from the examples directory, in this case a layout tailored for Golang development.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mustafamohsen/tmuxify/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
tmuxify --file examples/layouts/golang-dev.yml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Tmuxify to system bin directory
DESCRIPTION: Command to install Tmuxify to /usr/local/bin which requires sudo privileges. Downloads the script from GitHub and makes it executable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mustafamohsen/tmuxify/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
sudo curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mustafamohsen/tmuxify/main/tmuxify \
  -o /usr/local/bin/tmuxify && sudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/tmuxify
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Tmuxify to user bin directory
DESCRIPTION: Command to install Tmuxify to ~/bin without requiring sudo privileges. Downloads the script from GitHub and makes it executable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mustafamohsen/tmuxify/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mustafamohsen/tmuxify/main/tmuxify \
  -o ~/bin/tmuxify && chmod +x ~/bin/tmuxify
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Tmuxify
DESCRIPTION: Command to update an existing Tmuxify installation to the latest version using the built-in update flag.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mustafamohsen/tmuxify/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
tmuxify --update
```
